object.name: sendVideo
object.description: Use this method to send video files, Telegram clients support MPEG4 videos (other formats may be sent as Document). On success, the sent Message is returned. Bots can currently send video files of up to 50 MB in size, this limit may be changed in the future.
object.html_description: Use this method to send video files, Telegram clients support MPEG4 videos (other formats may be sent as Document). On success, the sent Message is returned. Bots can currently send video files of up to 50 MB in size, this limit may be changed in the future.
object.rst_description: Use this method to send video files, Telegram clients support MPEG4 videos (other formats may be sent as :class:`aiogram.types.document.Document`). On success, the sent :class:`aiogram.types.message.Message` is returned. Bots can currently send video files of up to 50 MB in size, this limit may be changed in the future.

annotations.description: Unique identifier of the business connection on behalf of which the message will be sent
annotations.html_description: Unique identifier of the business connection on behalf of which the message will be sent
annotations.rst_description: Unique identifier of the business connection on behalf of which the message will be sent
annotations.name: business_connection_id

annotations.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)
annotations.html_description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)
annotations.rst_description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format :code:`@channelusername`)
annotations.name: chat_id

annotations.description: Unique identifier for the target message thread (topic) of the forum; for forum supergroups only
annotations.html_description: Unique identifier for the target message thread (topic) of the forum; for forum supergroups only
annotations.rst_description: Unique identifier for the target message thread (topic) of the forum; for forum supergroups only
annotations.name: message_thread_id

annotations.description: Video to send. Pass a file_id as String to send a video that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a video from the Internet, or upload a new video using multipart/form-data. More information on Sending Files
annotations.html_description: Video to send. Pass a file_id as String to send a video that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a video from the Internet, or upload a new video using multipart/form-data. More information on Sending Files »
annotations.rst_description: Video to send. Pass a file_id as String to send a video that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a video from the Internet, or upload a new video using multipart/form-data. :ref:`More information on Sending Files » <sending-files>`
annotations.name: video

annotations.description: Duration of sent video in seconds
annotations.html_description: Duration of sent video in seconds
annotations.rst_description: Duration of sent video in seconds
annotations.name: duration

annotations.description: Video width
annotations.html_description: Video width
annotations.rst_description: Video width
annotations.name: width

annotations.description: Video height
annotations.html_description: Video height
annotations.rst_description: Video height
annotations.name: height

annotations.description: Thumbnail of the file sent; can be ignored if thumbnail generation for the file is supported server-side. The thumbnail should be in JPEG format and less than 200 kB in size. A thumbnail's width and height should not exceed 320. Ignored if the file is not uploaded using multipart/form-data. Thumbnails can't be reused and can be only uploaded as a new file, so you can pass 'attach://<file_attach_name>' if the thumbnail was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>. More information on Sending Files
annotations.html_description: Thumbnail of the file sent; can be ignored if thumbnail generation for the file is supported server-side. The thumbnail should be in JPEG format and less than 200 kB in size. A thumbnail's width and height should not exceed 320. Ignored if the file is not uploaded using multipart/form-data. Thumbnails can't be reused and can be only uploaded as a new file, so you can pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” if the thumbnail was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>. More information on Sending Files »
annotations.rst_description: Thumbnail of the file sent; can be ignored if thumbnail generation for the file is supported server-side. The thumbnail should be in JPEG format and less than 200 kB in size. A thumbnail's width and height should not exceed 320. Ignored if the file is not uploaded using multipart/form-data. Thumbnails can't be reused and can be only uploaded as a new file, so you can pass 'attach://<file_attach_name>' if the thumbnail was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>. :ref:`More information on Sending Files » <sending-files>`
annotations.name: thumbnail

annotations.description: Cover for the video in the message. Pass a file_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass 'attach://<file_attach_name>' to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name> name. More information on Sending Files
annotations.html_description: Cover for the video in the message. Pass a file_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name> name. More information on Sending Files »
annotations.rst_description: Cover for the video in the message. Pass a file_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass 'attach://<file_attach_name>' to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name> name. :ref:`More information on Sending Files » <sending-files>`
annotations.name: cover

annotations.description: Video caption (may also be used when resending videos by file_id), 0-1024 characters after entities parsing
annotations.html_description: Video caption (may also be used when resending videos by file_id), 0-1024 characters after entities parsing
annotations.rst_description: Video caption (may also be used when resending videos by *file_id*), 0-1024 characters after entities parsing
annotations.name: caption

annotations.description: Mode for parsing entities in the video caption. See formatting options for more details.
annotations.html_description: Mode for parsing entities in the video caption. See formatting options for more details.
annotations.rst_description: Mode for parsing entities in the video caption. See `formatting options <https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#formatting-options>`_ for more details.
annotations.name: parse_mode

annotations.description: A JSON-serialized list of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode
annotations.html_description: A JSON-serialized list of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode
annotations.rst_description: A JSON-serialized list of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of *parse_mode*
annotations.name: caption_entities

annotations.description: Pass True, if the caption must be shown above the message media
annotations.html_description: Pass True, if the caption must be shown above the message media
annotations.rst_description: Pass :code:`True`, if the caption must be shown above the message media
annotations.name: show_caption_above_media

annotations.description: Pass True if the video needs to be covered with a spoiler animation
annotations.html_description: Pass True if the video needs to be covered with a spoiler animation
annotations.rst_description: Pass :code:`True` if the video needs to be covered with a spoiler animation
annotations.name: has_spoiler

annotations.description: Pass True if the uploaded video is suitable for streaming
annotations.html_description: Pass True if the uploaded video is suitable for streaming
annotations.rst_description: Pass :code:`True` if the uploaded video is suitable for streaming
annotations.name: supports_streaming

annotations.description: Sends the message silently. Users will receive a notification with no sound.
annotations.html_description: Sends the message silently. Users will receive a notification with no sound.
annotations.rst_description: Sends the message `silently <https://telegram.org/blog/channels-2-0#silent-messages>`_. Users will receive a notification with no sound.
annotations.name: disable_notification

annotations.description: Protects the contents of the sent message from forwarding and saving
annotations.html_description: Protects the contents of the sent message from forwarding and saving
annotations.rst_description: Protects the contents of the sent message from forwarding and saving
annotations.name: protect_content

annotations.description: Pass True to allow up to 1000 messages per second, ignoring broadcasting limits for a fee of 0.1 Telegram Stars per message. The relevant Stars will be withdrawn from the bot's balance
annotations.html_description: Pass True to allow up to 1000 messages per second, ignoring broadcasting limits for a fee of 0.1 Telegram Stars per message. The relevant Stars will be withdrawn from the bot's balance
annotations.rst_description: Pass :code:`True` to allow up to 1000 messages per second, ignoring `broadcasting limits <https://core.telegram.org/bots/faq#how-can-i-message-all-of-my-bot-39s-subscribers-at-once>`_ for a fee of 0.1 Telegram Stars per message. The relevant Stars will be withdrawn from the bot's balance
annotations.name: allow_paid_broadcast

annotations.description: Unique identifier of the message effect to be added to the message; for private chats only
annotations.html_description: Unique identifier of the message effect to be added to the message; for private chats only
annotations.rst_description: Unique identifier of the message effect to be added to the message; for private chats only
annotations.name: message_effect_id

annotations.description: Description of the message to reply to
annotations.html_description: Description of the message to reply to
annotations.rst_description: Description of the message to reply to

annotations.type: InlineKeyboardMarkup or ReplyKeyboardMarkup or ReplyKeyboardRemove or ForceReply
annotations.description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard, custom reply keyboard, instructions to remove a reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user
annotations.html_description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard, custom reply keyboard, instructions to remove a reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user
annotations.rst_description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an `inline keyboard <https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards>`_, `custom reply keyboard <https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#keyboards>`_, instructions to remove a reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user
annotations.name: reply_markup

annotations.rst_description: Pass :code:`True` if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found
